item.title: Re: Special cards in the Arena
item.content:encoded:
Did you go up against HeroicFool Gogolu? The bloodline arena bonuses stack and loop, so if you change your bloodline between season 1 and 2, and get to 10 matches both time, you can have both RedEye and Legacy bonuses. Do it in seasons 1, 2, and 3, and you can have all of the racial bonuses.

If I'm not mistaken, both RedEye and WhiteEye get to use their powers twice per game. Legacy only once.

item.title: Re: Special cards in the Arena
item.content:encoded:
Yeah, I just pulled of 10.5 wins today, and I got the RedEye power, which is given by a special item called the Eye of the Tiger. I assume that you get whichever power your bloodline has (ie. I'm a RedEye, so I get RedEye power, Uzuki is Legacy, so he gets Legacy power), but I don't know.

(I'll probably try for 10+ wins in a day sometime soon again, which should be a lot easier with RedEye power, just to see what happens then, if anything.)

How I got the matches (and I think it's a little more effective than Uzuki's method):

For a few days, I purchased 6 matches (since they only cost 2000 ryo), and played them until I got a result that I was satisfied with (5 wins). After that, I just used arena points to purchase the remaining games (took 11 more). I think it's better because the 2000 ryo/day is pretty cheep, so it's not killing your wallet, and the fact that you don't seriously go after it until you already have 5-ish wins means that you're only playing chance with the other 5, not all 10. Also, assuming you keep another 4500 ryo in stock, you've got 3 backup plays if you need them.

item.title: Re: Special cards in the Arena
item.content:encoded:
My understanding is that you have to win 10 matches in the same day.

I've been knocking this around in my head for a bit, but here's how I think you have to do it…

Spend 6,500 ryo for 9 matches.
Have a Hollow Leg for 2x Emergency Rations for another 6 matches.
Use arena points to buy as many more games as you need. I would expect at least 5 more (or 750 arena points worth).

That'd give you 20 matches in one day. I average winning about 53% of the time, so across 20 matches I should be safe. But I probably won't attempt it until I've got 1,000 arena points to spare.
